body:
Hi,

I'm the owner of [vim-doge](https://github.com/kkoomen/vim-doge) and got an issue regarding nvim [kkoomen/vim-doge#358](https://github.com/kkoomen/vim-doge/issues/358). NVIM v0.5.x does not have this issue, only v0.6.x and above. It seems that the autoload logic might have changed in v0.6.0 which causes this.

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

0.6.0

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

no, any version of vim works, it's a a nvim specific issue since 0.6.0

### Operating system/version

macOS 12.4

### Terminal name/version

iTerm 3.4.15

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-256color

### Installation

Downloaded the binary from the releases page

### How to reproduce the issue

1) Download nvim-0.6.0 from the releases page
2) Create `doge.vimrc`:

```vim
set nocompatible
filetype plugin indent on

call plug#begin('~/.vim/plugged')
Plug 'kkoomen/vim-doge', { 'do': { -> doge#install() } }
call plug#end()

syntax on
set hidden
```

2) Run the following command `rm -rf ~/.vim/plugged/vim-doge && ~/Downloads/nvim-osx64/bin/nvim -u doge.vimrc` (I added the `rm -rf ~/.vim/plugged/vim-doge` here, because the error only occurs when you're doing a fresh install of vim-doge).
3) Run `:PlugInstall`
4) See error.

### Expected behavior

The `:PlugInstall` command should install properly with the result from below (using nvim v0.5.x or earlier)

```
Updated. Elapsed time: 1.490385 sec.
[=]

- Finishing ... Done! 
- Post-update hook for vim-doge ... OK
- vim-doge: Resolving deltas: 100% (1548/1548), done.
```

### Actual behavior

The `:PlugInstall` command fails with nvim v0.6.0 or above with the following output:

```
Updated. Elapsed time: 1.485336 sec. 
[x]  
 
- Finishing ... Done!
x Post-update hook for vim-doge ... Vim(let):E117: Unknown function: doge#helpers#deepextend                                                                   
- vim-doge: Resolving deltas: 100% (1549/1549), done.
```

**NOTE**: I already confirmed that this is **not** a vim-plug issue.

comment_data.body:
Bisected to ~

```
[9df7e022b498cb74ffbf5b8fd2ddc4dd5c04d127] fix(runtime): add packages as "/pack/*/start/*" patterns to &rtp
```

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/commit/9df7e022b498cb74ffbf5b8fd2ddc4dd5c04d127

```
root@8b760700c955:/neovim# git bisect log
git bisect start
# bad: [c632f64e247c672e425f609bb47a9ab0517a4c31] Merge pull request #18583 from gpanders/path-root
git bisect bad c632f64e247c672e425f609bb47a9ab0517a4c31
# good: [a5ac2f45ff84a688a09479f357a9909d5b914294] NVIM v0.5.0
git bisect good 9778fc7188714ac152242e1b8feb0a43427e47e2
# skip: [00915864f72e0052ecdb40629c838c622c7720a0] Merge pull request #17184 from zeertzjq/vim-8.2.4190
git bisect skip 00915864f72e0052ecdb40629c838c622c7720a0
# bad: [1e0613f58c7ebf7e1f9a8014cc672cd1ef0b4f47] vim-patch:8.1.2358: tests fail on Cirrus CI for FreeBSD
git bisect bad 1e0613f58c7ebf7e1f9a8014cc672cd1ef0b4f47
# bad: [122c0dfb5dbcfb1044debc1fef4706eb90741713] vim-patch:8.1.2378: using old C style comments
git bisect bad 122c0dfb5dbcfb1044debc1fef4706eb90741713
# good: [413e86869ef147431a78946562c125938b41f533] Merge #14611 from seandewar/vim-8.1.1116
git bisect good 413e86869ef147431a78946562c125938b41f533
# good: [ff18a8bcc4749c7ee169b63ef05ac1238d2de26e] refactor(lsp): remove json encode/decode wrappers (#15826)
git bisect good ff18a8bcc4749c7ee169b63ef05ac1238d2de26e
# bad: [e9d6f7ca6c7739960e8f571f7e5dbe5e5c5ffc0a] feat(lsp): utilize textEdit.range for startbyte in omnifunc (#15957)
git bisect bad e9d6f7ca6c7739960e8f571f7e5dbe5e5c5ffc0a
# bad: [44f7b46199aebedb0ff7f8ce782b375a0e156b27] refactor: remove redundant char casts #15888
git bisect bad 44f7b46199aebedb0ff7f8ce782b375a0e156b27
# good: [9c268263b1792d00b3ffdfd7495af2575862656e] refactor: format with uncrustify #15842
git bisect good 9c268263b1792d00b3ffdfd7495af2575862656e
# bad: [0c06da1f0a0ebe45c92d2c1d63121c6ead604fe5] fix(nvim_open_win): crash if autocmds delete buffer/window #15549
git bisect bad 0c06da1f0a0ebe45c92d2c1d63121c6ead604fe5
# bad: [8c74c895b300bcee5fa937a2329d1d4756567b42] refactor: format with uncrustify #15872
git bisect bad 8c74c895b300bcee5fa937a2329d1d4756567b42
# bad: [c4857b695fe2ffa9fc74da01b01809480510ac39] fix(input): resolve isolated (non-ALT/META) mappings #13109
git bisect bad c4857b695fe2ffa9fc74da01b01809480510ac39
# bad: [79fb9ed080bb32a442d1c788da6f0b71d72bcedd] Merge pull request #15867 from bfredl/starpack
git bisect bad 79fb9ed080bb32a442d1c788da6f0b71d72bcedd
root@8b760700c955:/neovim#
```

For completeness, the error also persists with this vim-plug setup:

```
call plug#begin('~/.local/share/nvim/site/pack/vim-plug/start')
```

Which I believe is the correct "pack" layout:

```
root@8b760700c955:/neovim# ls ~/.local/share/nvim/site/pack/vim-plug/start/vim-doge/
CHANGELOG.md        CONTRIBUTING.md  README.md        autoload              doc       package-lock.json  plugin   src   tsconfig.json
CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md  LICENSE          addon-info.json  commitlint.config.js  ftplugin  package.json       scripts  test
```

I can call `doge#install()`, after doge is cloned down (manually or by vim-plug), so the function is found *at some point*, the autoload code is functional but perhaps there is a particular interaction with how vim-plug alters the RTP and it runs the 'do' function before whatever change is needed has propagated up/out/over/beyond.
@rktjmp So, to confirm, this is indeed a bug in nvim v0.6.0 and higher, right?

Try the development version

- The [Releases](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/releases/tag/nightly) page has pre-built archives for Linux/Windows/macOS. 
- Check `:version` to confirm that you are using the latest version.

labels.description: wrong behavior that was introduced in a previous commit (please bisect)
labels.name: bug-regression

labels.description: issue has been tracked to a specific commit
labels.name: has:bisected

title: Autoloading not working properly since v0.6.0
